OVERVIEW: The Poe series consists of moderately deep, somewhat poorly drained soils that formed in sediments weathered from tuff, basalt, diatomite, and ash.  Poe soils are on terraces and have slopes of 0 to 2 percent.  The mean annual precipitation is about 12 inches and the mean annual temperature is about 48 degrees F.

TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Sandy, mixed, mesic Typic Durixerepts

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Poe loamy fine sand, irrigated pasture.  (Colors are for moist soil unless otherwise stated.)
Ap1--0 to 3 inches; very dark brown (10YR 2/2) loamy fine sand, gray (10YR 5/1) dry; weak very fine granular structure; soft, very friable; common very fine roots; many very fine pores; strongly effervescent; moderately alkaline (pH 8.2); clear smooth boundary.  (2 to 8 inches thick)
Ap2--3 to 9 inches; very dark grayish brown (10YR 2/2) loamy sand, gray (10YR 5/1) dry; weak medium subangular blocky structure; soft, very friable; common very fine roots; few medium and common very fine tubular pores; strongly effervescent; moderately alkaline (pH 8.3); gradual smooth boundary.  (0 to 10 inches thick)
AC--9 to 16 inches; very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) loamy sand, gray (10YR 5/2) dry; massive; soft, very friable; common very fine roots; few very fine tubular pores; strongly effervescent; moderately alkaline (pH 8.3); gradual smooth boundary.  (4 to 12 inches thick)
C1--16 to 22 inches; very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) loamy sand, light brownish gray (10YR 5/2) dry; massive; soft, very friable; few very fine roots; few very fine tubular pores; weakly effervescent; moderately alkaline (pH 8.0); gradual smooth boundary.  (0 to 12 inches thick)
C2--22 to 30 inches; dark grayish brown (10YR 4/2) loamy sand, light brownish gray (10YR 6/2) dry; few fine faint dark brown mottles; massive; soft, very friable; few very fine roots; common very fine tubular pores;  mildly alkaline (pH 7.8); abrupt wavy boundary.  (6 to 12 inches thick)
2Cqm1--30 to 36 inches; very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) and very dark brown (10YR 2/2) duripan; platy structure; extremely firm; indurated; few very fine roots in vertical fractures; vertical fractures coated with dark brown (10YR 4/3) opal; gray (10YR 6/1) indurated laminar cap at top of duripan; moderately alkaline (pH 8.2); abrupt smooth boundary.  (0 to 10 inches thick)
2Cqm2--36 to 46 inches; very dark brown (10YR 2/2) and very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) duripan; platy structure; extremely firm; indurated; few very fine roots in vertical fractures; vertical fractures coated with opal; gray (10YR 6/1) indurated laminar cap at top of duripan; moderately alkaline (pH 8.2).

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Klamath County, Oregon; about 4 miles east and 3 miles south of Klamath Falls; 2,700 feet east and 1,350 feet south of the northwest corner of section 29, T. 39 S., R. 10 E.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:  The mean annual soil temperature ranges from 48 to 51 degrees F.  Hue is 10YR or 2.5Y.  Organic carbon is less than 0.6 percent at depths less than 6 inches or throughout the soil.  The soil dominantly is moderately to very strongly alkaline above the duripan.  It has 0 to 5 percent gravel of 2 to 5 mm. in diameter throughout.  Depth to the duripan ranges from 20 to 40 inches.
The A horizon has value of 2 to 4 moist, 4 to 6 dry, and chroma of 1 to 3.
The C horizon has value of 3 to 5 moist and 5 to 7 dry.  It is loamy fine sand or loamy sand.  Field estimated and measured clay range from 7 to 10 percent and are less than 2.5 times 15 bar water values.  This horizon has up to 15 percent durinodes.
The duripan ranges from 4 to more than 30 inches in thickness and has an indurated opal cap of 1 to 2 mm. thickness and vertical coatings of opal.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  There are no competing series, the Agate series is similar.  Agate soils are fine-loamy.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  Poe soils are on low terraces at elevations of 4,035 to 4,300 feet.  Slopes are 0 to 3 percent.  The soils formed in alluvial-lacustrine sediments weathered from tuff basalt, diatomite, and ash.  The climate is semiarid with warm dry summers and cold moist winters.  The mean annual precipitation is 10 to 14 inches.  The mean January temperature is 28 degrees F.; the mean July temperature is 67 degrees F.; and the mean annual temperture is 46 to 49 degrees F.  The frost-free period is 65 to 110 days.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the Fordney, Henley, and Laki soils.  Fordney and Laki soils have a mollic epipedon and lack a duripan.  Fordney soils also are noncalcareous.  Henley and Laki soils are fine-loamy.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Somewhat poorly drained; very slow runoff; moderately rapid permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  The soils are used for production of irrigated crops including potatoes, alfalfa hay, wheat, oats, barley, and pasture.  They also are used for dwellings and for other community uses.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  Lake basins in south-central Oregon and northern California.  The soils are moderately extensive.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Davis, California

ADDITIONAL DATA.content:
ADDITIONAL DATA:  Characterization data on 2 profile (S67 Oreg. 18-7 and 18-8) reported in Riverside Soil Survey Laboratory report for Poe soils sampled in Klamath County, Oregon, 1967.  Profile 18-7 is the type location.
NATIONAL COOPERATIVE SOIL SURVEY
